In 2014, Mary Barra became the CEO of General Motors,...
...with 225,000 employees and selling 10 million vehicles globally last year.
Barra's leadership was tested early in her tenure.
During her first year as CEO, GM recalled 30 million cars worldwide that caused 124 deaths.
GM paid 900 million dollars in government fines.
In 2009 before she became CEO, GM filed for bankruptcy.
But under Barra, GM seems to be making a comeback,...
...with a net revenue of 166 billion dollars last year.
